thread.title: Helen Flanagan's on screen sister reveals what it was that persuaded her to return to Coronation Street
thread.title_full: Helen Flanagan's on screen sister reveals what it was that persuaded her to return to Coronation Street

author: Mark Jefferies
title: Helen Flanagan's on screen sister reveals what it was that persuaded her to return to Coronation Street
text:
TV Helen Flanagan's on screen sister reveals what it was that persuaded her to return to Coronation Street Helen contacted her soap sister and admitted she wanted a return, and Brooke then passed on the message to show boss Kate Oates Share Helen and Brooke filming some of their scenes (Photo: FameFlynet UK Tel : +44 (0)20 3551 5049 Email : info@fameflynet.uk.com) Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Actress Brooke Vincent was the one that persuaded bosses to bring back her on-screen sister Helen Flanagan . 
Helen contacted her soap sister and admitted she wanted a return, and Brooke then passed on the message to show boss Kate Oates. 
Brooke , who herself is also return from a short break to do three months of theatre, explains: “I had a conversation with Helen before I was leaving and she said ‘oh darling I would love to come back’ so I told Kate (Oates, Corrie boss) and then I heard something about Helen coming back and I was like ‘are you coming back?’ and she said ‘yeah darling Kate rang me’. 
“I’m not saying I was the whole thing of it, but I definitely mentioned it to Kate she wanted to come back yeah.” 
Brooke also told how her character Sophie and sister Rosie Webster returning scene will be amusing for fans. Read More First look at Helen Flanagan's explosive return to Coronation Street as she's back on the cobbles Brooke Vincent has been away from the soap for nine weeks (Photo: Manchester Evening News) 
“It is quite a funny scene really, she says hello to everybody and then you just start seeing all these cases appear and then Rosie appears in tow. I bring her back with me which is cool, it was nice to come back together. 
“Rosie is a very ditzy character. There is my character that is serious, Kevin is serious, Sally is la-di-dah and then Rosie just shoots a bit more into it. 
“Helen is still funny. Because of having Matilda she is very maternal and she has always been lovely. 
“I think the thing is with Helen from being in it so young, a lot of people got under her skin and a lot of people pushed her into certain things and forced her to say things she didn’t mean. 
"She is a bit more aware of that and obviously coming back after taking time out. I would still say she is crazy but she is my friend and she is funny.” 
Brooke also insists her break from the soap to star in Be My Baby on stage for nine weeks will will benefit her acting in the soap too. Like us on Facebook
